config_defs.name: connection.url
config_defs.documentation:
List of Elasticsearch HTTP connection URLs, for examplehttp://eshost1:9200,http://eshost2:9200, orhttps://eshost3:9200. If
any of the URLs specifieshttps:protocol, HTTPS will be used for all
connections. A URL with no protocol will be treated ashttp.Type: listValid Values: List of valid URIs.Importance: high

config_defs.name: connection.username
config_defs.documentation:
The username used to authenticate with Elasticsearch. The default is the null, and authentication will only be performed
if both the username and password are non-null.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: connection.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password used to authenticate with Elasticsearch. The default is the null, and authentication will only be performed
if both the username and password are non-null.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: batch.size
config_defs.documentation: The number of records to process as a batch when writing to Elasticsearch.Type: intDefault: 2000Valid Values: [1,â¦,1000000]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: bulk.size.bytes
config_defs.documentation:
The maximum size (in bytes) to be process as a batch when writing records to Elasticsearch.
Setting to â-1â will disable this configuration. If the condition set by âbatch.sizeâ is
met first, it will be used instead.Type: longDefault: 5242880 (5 megabytes)Valid Values: [-1,â¦,2147483647]Importance: low

config_defs.name: max.in.flight.requests
config_defs.documentation: The maximum number of indexing requests that can be in-flight to Elasticsearch before blocking further requests.Type: intDefault: 5Valid Values: [1,â¦,1000]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: max.buffered.records
config_defs.documentation:
The maximum number of records each task will buffer before blocking acceptance of more records. This config can be used
to limit the memory usage for each task.Type: intDefault: 20000Valid Values: [1,â¦,2147483647]Importance: low

config_defs.name: linger.ms
config_defs.documentation:
Linger time in milliseconds for batching. Records that arrive in between
request transmissions are batched into a single bulk indexing request, based
on thebatch.sizeconfiguration. Normally this only occurs under load when
records arrive faster than they can be sent out. However it may be desirable
to reduce the number of requests even under light load and benefit from bulk
indexing. This setting helps accomplish that - when a pending batch is not
full, rather than immediately sending it out the task will wait up to the
given delay to allow other records to be added so that they can be batched
into a single request.Type: longDefault: 1Valid Values: [0,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: flush.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The timeout in milliseconds to use for periodic flushing, and when waiting for
buffer space to be made available by completed requests as records are added.
If this timeout is exceeded the task will fail.Type: longDefault: 180000 (3 minutes)Valid Values: [1000,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: flush.synchronously
config_defs.documentation:
True if flushes should wait for background processing to finish. This has a
throughput penalty and makes the connector less responsive but allows for
topic-mutating SMTs (for example,RegexRouterorTimestampRouter).Type: BooleanDefault:falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: max.retries
config_defs.documentation:
The maximum number of retries that are allowed for failed indexing requests.
If the retry attempts are exhausted the task will fail.Type: intDefault: 5Valid Values: [0,â¦,2147483647]Importance: low

config_defs.name: retry.backoff.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait before attempting the first retry
of a failed indexing request. Upon a failure, this connector may wait up to
twice as long as the previous wait, up to the maximum number of retries. This
avoids retrying in a tight loop under failure scenarios.Type: longDefault: 100Valid Values: [0,â¦,86400000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.compression
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to use GZip compression on HTTP connection to ElasticSearch. To make
this setting to work thehttp.compressionsetting also needs to be enabled
at the Elasticsearch nodes before using it.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: max.connection.idle.time.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait before dropping an idle connection
to prevent a read timeout.Type: intDefault: 60000 (1 minute)Valid Values: [-1,â¦,86400000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait when establishing a connection to
the Elasticsearch server. The task fails if the client fails to connect to the
server in this interval, and will need to be restarted.Type: intDefault: 1000 (1 second)Valid Values: [0,â¦,43200000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: read.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the Elasticsearch server to send a
response. The task fails if any read operation times out, and will need to be
restarted to resume further operations.Type: intDefault: 3000 (3 seconds)Valid Values: [0,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: log.sensitive.data
config_defs.documentation:
If set totrue, the parameter logs sensitive data, such as exception
traces containing sensitive data. Note that this is parameter is optional.
Confluent recommends you configurelog.sensitive.dataif you experience
unusual logging behavior after upgrading to a later version of the connector.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: key.ignore
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to ignore the record key for the purpose of forming the Elasticsearch
document ID. When this is set totrue, document IDs will be generated as
the recordâstopic+partition+offset. Note that this is a global config
that applies to all topics, usetopic.key.ignoreto override astruefor specific topics.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: high

config_defs.name: schema.ignore
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to ignore schemas during indexing. When this is set totrue, the
record schema will be ignored for the purpose of registering an Elasticsearch
mapping. Elasticsearch will infer the mapping from the data (dynamic mapping
needs to be enabled by the user). Note that this is a global config that
applies to all topics, usetopic.schema.ignoreto override astruefor
specific topics.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: compact.map.entries
config_defs.documentation:
Defines how map entries with string keys within record values should be
written to JSON. When this is set totrue, these entries are written
compactly as"entryKey":"entryValue". Otherwise, map entries with string
keys are written as a nested document{"key":"entryKey","value":"entryValue"}. All map entries with non-string keys are always written as
nested documents. Prior to 3.3.0, this connector always wrote map entries as
nested documents, so set this tofalseto use that older behavior.Type: booleanDefault: trueImportance: low

config_defs.name: topic.key.ignore
config_defs.documentation: List of topics for whichkey.ignoreshould betrue.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: topic.schema.ignore
config_defs.documentation: List of topics for whichschema.ignoreshould betrue.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: drop.invalid.message
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to drop the Kafka message when it cannot be converted to an output
message.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: behavior.on.null.values
config_defs.documentation:
How to handle records with a non-null key and a null value (for example, Kafka
tombstone records). Valid options areIGNORE,DELETE, andFAIL.Type: stringDefault: FAILValid Values: [IGNORE, DELETE, FAIL]Importance: low

config_defs.name: behavior.on.malformed.documents
config_defs.documentation:
How to handle records that Elasticsearch rejects due to the following
malformed document exception errors:strict_dynamic_mapping_exceptionmapper_parsing_exceptionillegal_argument_exceptionaction_request_validation_exceptionignorewill skip records with these errors.failwill fail the
connector.NoteIn case of other malformed document errors, the connector sends
the records to the DLQ along with the exception and the connector fails,
even if this property is set toignore.Type: stringDefault: FAILValid Values: [ignore, warn, fail]Importance: low

config_defs.name: write.method
config_defs.documentation:
Method used for writing data to Elasticsearch, and one of INSERT or UPSERT.
The default method is INSERT in which the connector constructs a document from
the record value and inserts that document into Elasticsearch, completely
replacing any existing document with the same ID; this matches previous
behavior. The UPSERT method will create a new document if one with the
specified ID does not yet exist, or will update an existing document with the
same ID by adding or replacing only those fields present in the record value.
The UPSERT method may require additional time and resources of Elasticsearch,
so consider increasing theread.timeout.msand decreasing thebatch.sizeconfiguration properties.Type: stringDefault: INSERTValid Values: [INSERT, UPSERT]Importance: low

config_defs.name: use.autogenerated.ids
config_defs.documentation: Specifies whether to use auto-generated Elasticsearch document IDs for insertion requests. Note that this setting removes exactly once guarantees, and message delivery will be at least once. This only applies if the write method is set toINSERT. When set totrue, the Ignore Key mode option will also be ignored when sending data to Elasticsearch.Type: stringDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: proxy.host
config_defs.documentation:
The address of the proxy host to connect through. Supports the basic
authentication scheme only.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: proxy.port
config_defs.documentation: The port of the proxy host to connect through.Type: intDefault: 8080Valid Values: [1,â¦,65535]Importance: low

config_defs.name: proxy.username
config_defs.documentation: The username for the proxy host.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: proxy.password
config_defs.documentation: The password for the proxy host.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.security.protocol
config_defs.documentation: The security protocol to use when connecting to Elasticsearch. Values can bePLAINTEXTorSSL. IfPLAINTEXTis passed, all configs prefixed byelastic.https.will be ignored. This is optional for client.Type: stringDefault:PLAINTEXTValid Values: [PLAINTEXT, SSL]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for
client.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.location
config_defs.documentation:
The location of the key store file. This is optional for client and can be
used for two-way authentication for client.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation:
The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and
only needed ifssl.keystore.locationis configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.truststore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the trust store file.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password for the trust store file. If a password is not set, access to the
trust store is still available, but integrity checking is disabled.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.enabled.protocols
config_defs.documentation:
The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections. The default isTLSv1.2,TLSv1.3when running with Java 11 or later, andTLSv1.2otherwise. With the default value for Java 11, clients and servers will preferTLSv1.3if both support it and fallback toTLSv1.2otherwise (assuming
both support at leastTLSv1.2). This default should be fine for most cases.
Also see the configuration documentation forssl.protocol.Type: listDefault: TLSv1.2,TLSv1.3Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.protocol
config_defs.documentation:
The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext. The default isTLSv1.3when running with Java 11 or later,TLSv1.2otherwise. This value should
be fine for most use cases. Most recent JVMs allowTLSv1.2andTLSv1.3.TLS,TLSv1.1,SSL,SSLv2, andSSLv3may be
supported in older JVMs, but their usage is discouraged due to known security
vulnerabilities. With the default value for this config andssl.enabled.protocols, clients will downgrade toTLSv1.2if the server
does not supportTLSv1.3. If this config is set toTLSv1.2, clients
will not useTLSv1.3even if it is one of the values in
ssl.enabled.protocols and the server only supportsTLSv1.3.Type: stringDefault: TLSv1.2Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.provider
config_defs.documentation:
The name of the security provider used for SSL connections. Default value is
the default security provider of the JVM.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.truststore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the trust store file.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.cipher.suites
config_defs.documentation:
A list of cipher suites. This is a named combination of authentication,
encryption, MAC and key exchange algorithm used to negotiate the security
settings for a network connection using TLS or SSL network protocol. By
default all the available cipher suites are supported.Type: listDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm
config_defs.documentation:
The endpoint identification algorithm to validate server hostname using server
certificate. Disable server host name verification by settingelastic.https.ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithmto an empty string.Type: stringDefault: httpsImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.engine.factory.class
config_defs.documentation: The class of typeorg.apache.kafka.common.security.auth.SslEngineFactoryto provide SSLEngine objects. Default value isorg.apache.kafka.common.security.ssl.DefaultSslEngineFactoryType: classDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keymanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation:
The algorithm used by key manager factory for SSL connections. Default value
is the key manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.Type: stringDefault: SunX509Importance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.secure.random.implementation
config_defs.documentation: The SecureRandom PRNG implementation to use for SSL cryptography operations.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.trustmanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation:
The algorithm used by the trust manager factory for SSL connections. Default
value is the trust manager factory algorithm configured for the JVM.Type: stringDefault: PKIXImportance: low

config_defs.name: kerberos.user.principal
config_defs.documentation: The Kerberos user principal the connector may use to authenticate with Kerberos.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: kerberos.keytab.path
config_defs.documentation: The path to the keytab file to use for authentication with Kerberos.Type: stringDefault: nullValid Values: Existing file with keytab extension.Importance: low
config_defs.default: nullvalid values: existing file with keytab extension.importance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.dataset
config_defs.documentation: Describes the data ingested and its structure to be written to a data stream. This can be any arbitrary string, provided it is no longer than 100 characters, in all lowercase, and does not contain spaces or any special characters (/\\*\"<>|,#:-). If no value is set, the connector writes to regular indices. If set, this configuration will be used alongsidedata.stream.typeto construct the data stream name in the form of {data.stream.type}-{data.stream.dataset}-{data.stream.namespace}.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: A valid dataset name that is all lowercase, less than 100 characters, and does not contain any spaces, or invalid characters\/*?"<>|,#-:.Importance: low
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: a valid dataset name that is all lowercase, less than 100 characters, and does not contain any spaces, or invalid characters\/*?"<>|,#-:.importance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.type
config_defs.documentation: Describes the generic type of data to be written to a data stream. The default value isnone, indicating that the connector will write to regular indices. If set, this configuration will be used alongsidedata.stream.datasetto construct the data stream name in the form of {data.stream.type}-{data.stream.dataset}-{data.stream.namespace}. Possible values arelogs,metrics,none, and custom index templates defined in the destination cluster are also supported.`.Type: stringDefault:NONEValid Values: Possible values arelogs,metrics,``none`` and custom index templates defined in the destination cluster are supported as well.Importance: low
config_defs.default: nonevalid values: possible values arelogs,metrics,``none`` and custom index templates defined in the destination cluster are supported as well.importance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.timestamp.field
config_defs.documentation:
The Kafka record field to use as the timestamp for the@timestampfield
in documents sent to a data stream.All documents sent to a data stream needs an@timestampfield with values of
typedateordata_nanos. Otherwise, the document  will not be sent.
If multiple fields are provided, the first field listed that also appears
in the record will be used. If this configuration is left empty, all of the
documents will use the Kafka record timestamp as the@timestampfield
value. Note that@timestampstill  needs to be explicitly listed if
records already contain this field. This configuration can only be set
ifdata.stream.typeanddata.stream.datasetare set.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.namespace
config_defs.documentation: Describes a user-configurable arbitrary grouping for writing to a data stream. It can be any string up to 100 characters, in lowercase, without spaces or special characters (/\\*\"<>|,#:-). If unset, the connector writes to regular indices. When set, it is used withdata.stream.typeanddata.stream.datasetto form the data stream name in the format {data.stream.type}-{data.stream.dataset}-{data.stream.namespace}. Default is${topic}, which means the topic name.Type: stringDefault:${topic}Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.password

config_defs.name: elastic.security.protocol
config_defs.documentation: The security protocol to use when connecting to Elasticsearch. Values can bePLAINTEXTorSSL. IfPLAINTEXTis passed, all configs prefixed byelastic.https.will be ignored. This is optional for client.Type: stringDefault:PLAINTEXTValid Values: [PLAINTEXT, SSL]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation:

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.location
config_defs.documentation:

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation:
The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and
only needed ifssl.keystore.locationis configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.truststore.location

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation:

trust store is still available, but integrity checking is disabled.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.enabled.protocols
config_defs.documentation:
The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections. The default isTLSv1.2,TLSv1.3when running with Java 11 or later, andTLSv1.2otherwise. With the default value for Java 11, clients and servers will preferTLSv1.3if both support it and fallback toTLSv1.2otherwise (assuming
both support at leastTLSv1.2). This default should be fine for most cases.
Also see the configuration documentation forssl.protocol.Type: listDefault: TLSv1.2,TLSv1.3Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.protocol
config_defs.documentation:
The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext. The default isTLSv1.3when running with Java 11 or later,TLSv1.2otherwise. This value should
be fine for most use cases. Most recent JVMs allowTLSv1.2andTLSv1.3.TLS,TLSv1.1,SSL,SSLv2, andSSLv3may be
supported in older JVMs, but their usage is discouraged due to known security
vulnerabilities. With the default value for this config andssl.enabled.protocols, clients will downgrade toTLSv1.2if the server
does not supportTLSv1.3. If this config is set toTLSv1.2, clients
will not useTLSv1.3even if it is one of the values in
ssl.enabled.protocols and the server only supportsTLSv1.3.Type: stringDefault: TLSv1.2Importance: medium

settings for a network connection using TLS or SSL network protocol. By
default all the available cipher suites are supported.Type: listDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.dataset
config_defs.documentation: Describes the data ingested and its structure to be written to a data stream. This can be any arbitrary string, provided it is no longer than 100 characters, in all lowercase, and does not contain spaces or any special characters (/\\*\"<>|,#:-). If no value is set, the connector writes to regular indices. If set, this configuration will be used alongsidedata.stream.typeto construct the data stream name in the form of {data.stream.type}-{data.stream.dataset}-{data.stream.namespace}.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: A valid dataset name that is all lowercase, less than 100 characters, and does not contain any spaces, or invalid characters\/*?"<>|,#-:.Importance: low
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: a valid dataset name that is all lowercase, less than 100 characters, and does not contain any spaces, or invalid characters\/*?"<>|,#-:.importance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.type
config_defs.documentation: Describes the generic type of data to be written to a data stream. The default value isnone, indicating that the connector will write to regular indices. If set, this configuration will be used alongsidedata.stream.datasetto construct the data stream name in the form of {data.stream.type}-{data.stream.dataset}-{data.stream.namespace}. Possible values arelogs,metrics,none, and custom index templates defined in the destination cluster are also supported.`.Type: stringDefault:NONEValid Values: Possible values arelogs,metrics,``none`` and custom index templates defined in the destination cluster are supported as well.Importance: low
config_defs.default: nonevalid values: possible values arelogs,metrics,``none`` and custom index templates defined in the destination cluster are supported as well.importance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.timestamp.field
config_defs.documentation:
The Kafka record field to use as the timestamp for the@timestampfield
in documents sent to a data stream.All documents sent to a data stream needs an@timestampfield with values of
typedateordata_nanos. Otherwise, the document  will not be sent.
If multiple fields are provided, the first field listed that also appears
in the record will be used. If this configuration is left empty, all of the
documents will use the Kafka record timestamp as the@timestampfield
value. Note that@timestampstill  needs to be explicitly listed if
records already contain this field. This configuration can only be set
ifdata.stream.typeanddata.stream.datasetare set.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.namespace
config_defs.documentation: Describes a user-configurable arbitrary grouping for writing to a data stream. It can be any string up to 100 characters, in lowercase, without spaces or special characters (/\\*\"<>|,#:-). If unset, the connector writes to regular indices. When set, it is used withdata.stream.typeanddata.stream.datasetto form the data stream name in the format {data.stream.type}-{data.stream.dataset}-{data.stream.namespace}. Default is${topic}, which means the topic name.Type: stringDefault:${topic}Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.url
config_defs.documentation:
List of Elasticsearch HTTP connection URLs, for examplehttp://eshost1:9200,http://eshost2:9200, orhttps://eshost3:9200. If
any of the URLs specifieshttps:protocol, HTTPS will be used for all
connections. A URL with no protocol will be treated ashttp.Type: listValid Values: List of valid URIs.Importance: high

config_defs.name: connection.username
config_defs.documentation:
The username used to authenticate with Elasticsearch. The default is the null, and authentication will only be performed

config_defs.name: connection.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password used to authenticate with Elasticsearch. The default is the null, and authentication will only be performed
if both the username and password are non-null.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: batch.size
config_defs.documentation: The number of records to process as a batch when writing to Elasticsearch.Type: intDefault: 2000Valid Values: [1,â¦,1000000]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: bulk.size.bytes
config_defs.documentation:
The maximum size (in bytes) to be process as a batch when writing records to Elasticsearch.
Setting to â-1â will disable this configuration. If the condition set by âbatch.sizeâ is
met first, it will be used instead.Type: longDefault: 5242880 (5 megabytes)Valid Values: [-1,â¦,2147483647]Importance: low

config_defs.name: max.in.flight.requests
config_defs.documentation: The maximum number of indexing requests that can be in-flight to Elasticsearch before blocking further requests.Type: intDefault: 5Valid Values: [1,â¦,1000]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: max.buffered.records
config_defs.documentation:
The maximum number of records each task will buffer before blocking acceptance of more records. This config can be used
to limit the memory usage for each task.Type: intDefault: 20000Valid Values: [1,â¦,2147483647]Importance: low

config_defs.name: linger.ms
config_defs.documentation:
Linger time in milliseconds for batching. Records that arrive in between
request transmissions are batched into a single bulk indexing request, based
on thebatch.sizeconfiguration. Normally this only occurs under load when
records arrive faster than they can be sent out. However it may be desirable
to reduce the number of requests even under light load and benefit from bulk
indexing. This setting helps accomplish that - when a pending batch is not
full, rather than immediately sending it out the task will wait up to the
given delay to allow other records to be added so that they can be batched
into a single request.Type: longDefault: 1Valid Values: [0,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: flush.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The timeout in milliseconds to use for periodic flushing, and when waiting for
buffer space to be made available by completed requests as records are added.
If this timeout is exceeded the task will fail.Type: longDefault: 180000 (3 minutes)Valid Values: [1000,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: flush.synchronously
config_defs.documentation:
True if flushes should wait for background processing to finish. This has a
throughput penalty and makes the connector less responsive but allows for
topic-mutating SMTs (for example,RegexRouterorTimestampRouter).Type: BooleanDefault:falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: max.retries
config_defs.documentation:
The maximum number of retries that are allowed for failed indexing requests.
If the retry attempts are exhausted the task will fail.Type: intDefault: 5Valid Values: [0,â¦,2147483647]Importance: low

config_defs.name: retry.backoff.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait before attempting the first retry
of a failed indexing request. Upon a failure, this connector may wait up to
twice as long as the previous wait, up to the maximum number of retries. This
avoids retrying in a tight loop under failure scenarios.Type: longDefault: 100Valid Values: [0,â¦,86400000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.compression
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to use GZip compression on HTTP connection to ElasticSearch. To make
this setting to work thehttp.compressionsetting also needs to be enabled
at the Elasticsearch nodes before using it.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: max.connection.idle.time.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait before dropping an idle connection
to prevent a read timeout.Type: intDefault: 60000 (1 minute)Valid Values: [-1,â¦,86400000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait when establishing a connection to
the Elasticsearch server. The task fails if the client fails to connect to the
server in this interval, and will need to be restarted.Type: intDefault: 1000 (1 second)Valid Values: [0,â¦,43200000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: read.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the Elasticsearch server to send a
response. The task fails if any read operation times out, and will need to be
restarted to resume further operations.Type: intDefault: 3000 (3 seconds)Valid Values: [0,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: log.sensitive.data
config_defs.documentation:
If set totrue, the parameter logs sensitive data, such as exception
traces containing sensitive data. Note that this is parameter is optional.
Confluent recommends you configurelog.sensitive.dataif you experience
unusual logging behavior after upgrading to a later version of the connector.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: key.ignore
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to ignore the record key for the purpose of forming the Elasticsearch
document ID. When this is set totrue, document IDs will be generated as
the recordâstopic+partition+offset. Note that this is a global config
that applies to all topics, usetopic.key.ignoreto override astruefor specific topics.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: high

config_defs.name: schema.ignore
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to ignore schemas during indexing. When this is set totrue, the
record schema will be ignored for the purpose of registering an Elasticsearch
mapping. Elasticsearch will infer the mapping from the data (dynamic mapping
needs to be enabled by the user). Note that this is a global config that
applies to all topics, usetopic.schema.ignoreto override astruefor
specific topics.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: compact.map.entries
config_defs.documentation:
Defines how map entries with string keys within record values should be
written to JSON. When this is set totrue, these entries are written
compactly as"entryKey":"entryValue". Otherwise, map entries with string
keys are written as a nested document{"key":"entryKey","value":"entryValue"}. All map entries with non-string keys are always written as
nested documents. Prior to 3.3.0, this connector always wrote map entries as
nested documents, so set this tofalseto use that older behavior.Type: booleanDefault: trueImportance: low

config_defs.name: topic.key.ignore
config_defs.documentation: List of topics for whichkey.ignoreshould betrue.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.documentation:

config_defs.name: behavior.on.malformed.documents
config_defs.documentation:
How to handle records that Elasticsearch rejects due to the following
malformed document exception errors:strict_dynamic_mapping_exceptionmapper_parsing_exceptionillegal_argument_exceptionaction_request_validation_exceptionignorewill skip records with these errors.failwill fail the
connector.NoteIn case of other malformed document errors, the connector sends
the records to the DLQ along with the exception and the connector fails,
even if this property is set toignore.Type: stringDefault: FAILValid Values: [ignore, warn, fail]Importance: low

config_defs.name: write.method
config_defs.documentation:
Method used for writing data to Elasticsearch, and one of INSERT or UPSERT.
The default method is INSERT in which the connector constructs a document from
the record value and inserts that document into Elasticsearch, completely
replacing any existing document with the same ID; this matches previous
behavior. The UPSERT method will create a new document if one with the
specified ID does not yet exist, or will update an existing document with the
same ID by adding or replacing only those fields present in the record value.
The UPSERT method may require additional time and resources of Elasticsearch,
so consider increasing theread.timeout.msand decreasing thebatch.sizeconfiguration properties.Type: stringDefault: INSERTValid Values: [INSERT, UPSERT]Importance: low

config_defs.name: use.autogenerated.ids
config_defs.documentation: Specifies whether to use auto-generated Elasticsearch document IDs for insertion requests. config_defs.documentation:
The maximum number of records each task will buffer before blocking acceptance of more records. This config can be used
to limit the memory usage for each task.Type: intDefault: 20000Valid Values: [1,â¦,2147483647]Importance: low

config_defs.name: linger.ms
config_defs.documentation:
Linger time in milliseconds for batching. Records that arrive in between
request transmissions are batched into a single bulk indexing request, based
on thebatch.sizeconfiguration. Normally this only occurs under load when
records arrive faster than they can be sent out. However it may be desirable
to reduce the number of requests even under light load and benefit from bulk
indexing. This setting helps accomplish that - when a pending batch is not
full, rather than immediately sending it out the task will wait up to the
given delay to allow other records to be added so that they can be batched
into a single request.Type: longDefault: 1Valid Values: [0,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: flush.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The timeout in milliseconds to use for periodic flushing, and when waiting for
buffer space to be made available by completed requests as records are added.
If this timeout is exceeded the task will fail.Type: longDefault: 180000 (3 minutes)Valid Values: [1000,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: flush.synchronously
config_defs.documentation:
True if flushes should wait for background processing to finish. This has a
throughput penalty and makes the connector less responsive but allows for
topic-mutating SMTs (for example,RegexRouterorTimestampRouter).Type: BooleanDefault:falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: max.retries
config_defs.documentation:
The maximum number of retries that are allowed for failed indexing requests.
If the retry attempts are exhausted the task will fail.Type: intDefault: 5Valid Values: [0,â¦,2147483647]Importance: low

config_defs.name: retry.backoff.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait before attempting the first retry
of a failed indexing request. Upon a failure, this connector may wait up to
twice as long as the previous wait, up to the maximum number of retries. This
avoids retrying in a tight loop under failure scenarios.Type: longDefault: 100Valid Values: [0,â¦,86400000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.compression
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to use GZip compression on HTTP connection to ElasticSearch. To make
this setting to work thehttp.compressionsetting also needs to be enabled
at the Elasticsearch nodes before using it.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: max.connection.idle.time.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait before dropping an idle connection
to prevent a read timeout.Type: intDefault: 60000 (1 minute)Valid Values: [-1,â¦,86400000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait when establishing a connection to
the Elasticsearch server. The task fails if the client fails to connect to the
server in this interval, and will need to be restarted.Type: intDefault: 1000 (1 second)Valid Values: [0,â¦,43200000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: read.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the Elasticsearch server to send a
response. The task fails if any read operation times out, and will need to be
restarted to resume further operations.Type: intDefault: 3000 (3 seconds)Valid Values: [0,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: log.sensitive.data
config_defs.documentation:
If set totrue, the parameter logs sensitive data, such as exception
traces containing sensitive data. Note that this is parameter is optional.
Confluent recommends you configurelog.sensitive.dataif you experience
unusual logging behavior after upgrading to a later version of the connector.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: key.ignore
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to ignore the record key for the purpose of forming the Elasticsearch
document ID. When this is set totrue, document IDs will be generated as
the recordâstopic+partition+offset. Note that this is a global config
that applies to all topics, usetopic.key.ignoreto override astruefor specific topics.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: high

config_defs.name: schema.ignore
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to ignore schemas during indexing. When this is set totrue, the
record schema will be ignored for the purpose of registering an Elasticsearch
mapping. Elasticsearch will infer the mapping from the data (dynamic mapping
needs to be enabled by the user). Note that this is a global config that
applies to all topics, usetopic.schema.ignoreto override astruefor
specific topics.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: compact.map.entries
config_defs.documentation:
Defines how map entries with string keys within record values should be
written to JSON. When this is set totrue, these entries are written
compactly as"entryKey":"entryValue". Otherwise, map entries with string
keys are written as a nested document{"key":"entryKey","value":"entryValue"}. All map entries with non-string keys are always written as
nested documents. Prior to 3.3.0, this connector always wrote map entries as
nested documents, so set this tofalseto use that older behavior.Type: booleanDefault: trueImportance: low

config_defs.name: topic.key.ignore
config_defs.documentation: List of topics for whichkey.ignoreshould betrue.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: topic.schema.ignore
config_defs.documentation: List of topics for whichschema.ignoreshould betrue.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: drop.invalid.message
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to drop the Kafka message when it cannot be converted to an output
message.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: behavior.on.null.values
config_defs.documentation:
How to handle records with a non-null key and a null value (for example, Kafka
tombstone records). Valid options areIGNORE,DELETE, andFAIL.Type: stringDefault: FAILValid Values: [IGNORE, DELETE, FAIL]Importance: low

config_defs.name: behavior.on.malformed.documents
config_defs.documentation:
How to handle records that Elasticsearch rejects due to the following
malformed document exception errors:strict_dynamic_mapping_exceptionmapper_parsing_exceptionillegal_argument_exceptionaction_request_validation_exceptionignorewill skip records with these errors.failwill fail the
connector.NoteIn case of other malformed document errors, the connector sends
the records to the DLQ along with the exception and the connector fails,
even if this property is set toignore.Type: stringDefault: FAILValid Values: [ignore, warn, fail]Importance: low

config_defs.name: write.method
config_defs.documentation:
Method used for writing data to Elasticsearch, and one of INSERT or UPSERT.
The default method is INSERT in which the connector constructs a document from
the record value and inserts that document into Elasticsearch, completely
replacing any existing document with the same ID; this matches previous
behavior. The UPSERT method will create a new document if one with the
specified ID does not yet exist, or will update an existing document with the
same ID by adding or replacing only those fields present in the record value.
The UPSERT method may require additional time and resources of Elasticsearch,
so consider increasing theread.timeout.msand decreasing thebatch.sizeconfiguration properties.Type: stringDefault: INSERTValid Values: [INSERT, UPSERT]Importance: low

config_defs.name: use.autogenerated.ids
config_defs.documentation: Specifies whether to use auto-generated Elasticsearch document IDs for insertion requests. Note that this setting removes exactly once guarantees, and message delivery will be at least once. This only applies if the write method is set toINSERT. When set totrue, the Ignore Key mode option will also be ignored when sending data to Elasticsearch.Type: stringDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: proxy.host
config_defs.documentation:
The address of the proxy host to connect through. Supports the basic
authentication scheme only.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: proxy.port
config_defs.documentation: The port of the proxy host to connect through.Type: intDefault: 8080Valid Values: [1,â¦,65535]Importance: low

config_defs.name: proxy.username
config_defs.documentation: The username for the proxy host.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: proxy.password
config_defs.documentation: The password for the proxy host.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.security.protocol
config_defs.documentation: The security protocol to use when connecting to Elasticsearch. Values can bePLAINTEXTorSSL. IfPLAINTEXTis passed, all configs prefixed byelastic.https.will be ignored. This is optional for client.Type: stringDefault:PLAINTEXTValid Values: [PLAINTEXT, SSL]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for
client.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.location
config_defs.documentation:
The location of the key store file. This is optional for client and can be
used for two-way authentication for client.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation:
The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and
only needed ifssl.keystore.locationis configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.truststore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the trust store file.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password for the trust store file. If a password is not set, access to the
trust store is still available, but integrity checking is disabled.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.enabled.protocols
config_defs.documentation:
The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections. The default isTLSv1.2,TLSv1.3when running with Java 11 or later, andTLSv1.2otherwise. With the default value for Java 11, clients and servers will preferTLSv1.3if both support it and fallback toTLSv1.2otherwise (assuming
both support at leastTLSv1.2). This default should be fine for most cases.
Also see the configuration documentation forssl.protocol.Type: listDefault: TLSv1.2,TLSv1.3Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.protocol
config_defs.documentation:
The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext. The default isTLSv1.3when running with Java 11 or later,TLSv1.2otherwise. This value should
be fine for most use cases. Most recent JVMs allowTLSv1.2andTLSv1.3.TLS,TLSv1.1,SSL,SSLv2, andSSLv3may be
supported in older JVMs, but their usage is discouraged due to known security
vulnerabilities. With the default value for this config andssl.enabled.protocols, clients will downgrade toTLSv1.2if the server
does not supportTLSv1.3. If this config is set toTLSv1.2, clients
will not useTLSv1.3even if it is one of the values in
ssl.enabled.protocols and the server only supportsTLSv1.3.Type: stringDefault: TLSv1.2Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.provider
config_defs.documentation:
The name of the security provider used for SSL connections. Default value is
the default security provider of the JVM.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.truststore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the trust store file.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.cipher.suites
config_defs.documentation:
A list of cipher suites. This is a named combination of authentication,
encryption, MAC and key exchange algorithm used to negotiate the security
settings for a network connection using TLS or SSL network protocol. By
default all the available cipher suites are supported.Type: listDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm
config_defs.documentation:
The endpoint identification algorithm to validate server hostname using server
certificate. Disable server host name verification by settingelastic.https.ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithmto an empty string.Type: stringDefault: httpsImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.engine.factory.class
config_defs.documentation: The class of typeorg.apache.kafka.common.security.auth.SslEngineFactoryto provide SSLEngine objects. Default value isorg.apache.kafka.common.security.ssl.DefaultSslEngineFactoryType: classDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keymanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation:
The algorithm used by key manager factory for SSL connections. Default value
is the key manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.Type: stringDefault: SunX509Importance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.secure.random.implementation
config_defs.documentation: The SecureRandom PRNG implementation to use for SSL cryptography operations.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.trustmanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation:
The algorithm used by the trust manager factory for SSL connections. Default
value is the trust manager factory algorithm configured for the JVM.Type: stringDefault: PKIXImportance: low

config_defs.name: kerberos.user.principal
config_defs.documentation: The Kerberos user principal the connector may use to authenticate with Kerberos.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: kerberos.keytab.path
config_defs.documentation: The path to the keytab file to use for authentication with Kerberos.Type: stringDefault: nullValid Values: Existing file with keytab extension.Importance: low
config_defs.default: nullvalid values: existing file with keytab extension.importance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.dataset
config_defs.documentation: Describes the data ingested and its structure to be written to a data stream. This can be any arbitrary string, provided it is no longer than 100 characters, in all lowercase, and does not contain spaces or any special characters (/\\*\"<>|,#:-). If no value is set, the connector writes to regular indices. If set, this configuration will be used alongsidedata.stream.typeto construct the data stream name in the form of {data.stream.type}-{data.stream.dataset}-{data.stream.namespace}.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: A valid dataset name that is all lowercase, less than 100 characters, and does not contain any spaces, or invalid characters\/*?"<>|,#-:.Importance: low
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: a valid dataset name that is all lowercase, less than 100 characters, and does not contain any spaces, or invalid characters\/*?"<>|,#-:.importance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.type
config_defs.documentation: Describes the generic type of data to be written to a data stream. The default value isnone, indicating that the connector will write to regular indices. If set, this configuration will be used alongsidedata.stream.datasetto construct the data stream name in the form of {data.stream.type}-{data.stream.dataset}-{data.stream.namespace}. Possible values arelogs,metrics,none, and custom index templates defined in the destination cluster are also supported.`.Type: stringDefault:NONEValid Values: Possible values arelogs,metrics,``none`` and custom index templates defined in the destination cluster are supported as well.Importance: low
config_defs.default: nonevalid values: possible values arelogs,metrics,``none`` and custom index templates defined in the destination cluster are supported as well.importance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.timestamp.field
config_defs.documentation:
The Kafka record field to use as the timestamp for the@timestampfield
in documents sent to a data stream.All documents sent to a data stream needs an@timestampfield with values of
typedateordata_nanos. Otherwise, the document  will not be sent.
If multiple fields are provided, the first field listed that also appears
in the record will be used. If this configuration is left empty, all of the
documents will use the Kafka record timestamp as the@timestampfield
value. Note that@timestampstill  needs to be explicitly listed if
records already contain this field. This configuration can only be set
ifdata.stream.typeanddata.stream.datasetare set.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.namespace
config_defs.documentation: Describes a user-configurable arbitrary grouping for writing to a data stream. It can be any string up to 100 characters, in lowercase, without spaces or special characters (/\\*\"<>|,#:-). If unset, the connector writes to regular indices. When set, it is used withdata.stream.typeanddata.stream.datasetto form the data stream name in the format {data.stream.type}-{data.stream.dataset}-{data.stream.namespace}. Default is${topic}, which means the topic name.Type: stringDefault:${topic}Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.url
config_defs.documentation:
List of Elasticsearch HTTP connection URLs, for examplehttp://eshost1:9200,http://eshost2:9200, orhttps://eshost3:9200. If

config_defs.name: connection.username

if both the username and password are non-null.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: connection.password

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.enabled.protocols
config_defs.documentation:
The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections. The default isTLSv1.2,TLSv1.3when running with Java 11 or later, andTLSv1.2otherwise. With the default value for Java 11, clients and servers will preferTLSv1.3if both support it and fallback toTLSv1.2otherwise (assuming
both support at leastTLSv1.2). This default should be fine for most cases.
Also see the configuration documentation forssl.protocol.Type: listDefault: TLSv1.2,TLSv1.3Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.protocol
config_defs.documentation:
The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext. The default isTLSv1.3when running with Java 11 or later,TLSv1.2otherwise. This value should
be fine for most use cases. Most recent JVMs allowTLSv1.2andTLSv1.3.TLS,TLSv1.1,SSL,SSLv2, andSSLv3may be
supported in older JVMs, but their usage is discouraged due to known security
vulnerabilities. With the default value for this config andssl.enabled.protocols, clients will downgrade toTLSv1.2if the server
does not supportTLSv1.3. If this config is set toTLSv1.2, clients
will not useTLSv1.3even if it is one of the values in
ssl.enabled.protocols and the server only supportsTLSv1.3.Type: stringDefault: TLSv1.2Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.provider
config_defs.documentation:
The name of the security provider used for SSL connections. Default value is
the default security provider of the JVM.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.truststore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the trust store file.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.cipher.suites
config_defs.documentation:
A list of cipher suites. This is a named combination of authentication,
encryption, MAC and key exchange algorithm used to negotiate the security
settings for a network connection using TLS or SSL network protocol. By
default all the available cipher suites are supported.Type: listDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm
config_defs.documentation:
The endpoint identification algorithm to validate server hostname using server
certificate. Disable server host name verification by settingelastic.https.ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithmto an empty string.Type: stringDefault: httpsImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.engine.factory.class
config_defs.documentation: The class of typeorg.apache.kafka.common.security.auth.SslEngineFactoryto provide SSLEngine objects. Default value isorg.apache.kafka.common.security.ssl.DefaultSslEngineFactoryType: classDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keymanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation:
The algorithm used by key manager factory for SSL connections. Default value
is the key manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.Type: stringDefault: SunX509Importance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.secure.random.implementation
config_defs.documentation: The SecureRandom PRNG implementation to use for SSL cryptography operations.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.trustmanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation:
The algorithm used by the trust manager factory for SSL connections. Default
value is the trust manager factory algorithm configured for the JVM.Type: stringDefault: PKIXImportance: low

config_defs.name: kerberos.user.principal
config_defs.documentation: The Kerberos user principal the connector may use to authenticate with Kerberos.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: kerberos.keytab.path
config_defs.documentation: The path to the keytab file to use for authentication with Kerberos.Type: stringDefault: nullValid Values: Existing file with keytab extension.Importance: low
config_defs.default: nullvalid values: existing file with keytab extension.importance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.dataset
config_defs.documentation: Describes the data ingested and its structure to be written to a data stream. This can be any arbitrary string, provided it is no longer than 100 characters, in all lowercase, and does not contain spaces or any special characters (/\\*\"<>|,#:-). If no value is set, the connector writes to regular indices. If set, this configuration will be used alongsidedata.stream.typeto construct the data stream name in the form of {data.stream.type}-{data.stream.dataset}-{data.stream.namespace}.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: A valid dataset name that is all lowercase, less than 100 characters, and does not contain any spaces, or invalid characters\/*?"<>|,#-:.Importance: low
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: a valid dataset name that is all lowercase, less than 100 characters, and does not contain any spaces, or invalid characters\/*?"<>|,#-:.importance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.type
config_defs.documentation: Describes the generic type of data to be written to a data stream. The default value isnone, indicating that the connector will write to regular indices. If set, this configuration will be used alongsidedata.stream.datasetto construct the data stream name in the form of {data.stream.type}-{data.stream.dataset}-{data.stream.namespace}. Possible values arelogs,metrics,none, and custom index templates defined in the destination cluster are also supported.`.Type: stringDefault:NONEValid Values: Possible values arelogs,metrics,``none`` and custom index templates defined in the destination cluster are supported as well.Importance: low
config_defs.default: nonevalid values: possible values arelogs,metrics,``none`` and custom index templates defined in the destination cluster are supported as well.importance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.timestamp.field
config_defs.documentation:
The Kafka record field to use as the timestamp for the@timestampfield
in documents sent to a data stream.All documents sent to a data stream needs an@timestampfield with values of
typedateordata_nanos. Otherwise, the document  will not be sent.
If multiple fields are provided, the first field listed that also appears
in the record will be used. If this configuration is left empty, all of the
documents will use the Kafka record timestamp as the@timestampfield
value. Note that@timestampstill  needs to be explicitly listed if
records already contain this field. This configuration can only be set
ifdata.stream.typeanddata.stream.datasetare set.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: data.stream.namespace
config_defs.documentation: Describes a user-configurable arbitrary grouping for writing to a data stream. It can be any string up to 100 characters, in lowercase, without spaces or special characters (/\\*\"<>|,#:-). If unset, the connector writes to regular indices. When set, it is used withdata.stream.typeanddata.stream.datasetto form the data stream name in the format {data.stream.type}-{data.stream.dataset}-{data.stream.namespace}. Default is${topic}, which means the topic name.Type: stringDefault:${topic}Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.url
config_defs.documentation:
List of Elasticsearch HTTP connection URLs, for examplehttp://eshost1:9200,http://eshost2:9200, orhttps://eshost3:9200. If
any of the URLs specifieshttps:protocol, HTTPS will be used for all
connections. A URL with no protocol will be treated ashttp.Type: listValid Values: List of valid URIs.Importance: high

config_defs.name: connection.username
config_defs.documentation:
The username used to authenticate with Elasticsearch. The default is the null, and authentication will only be performed
if both the username and password are non-null.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: connection.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password used to authenticate with Elasticsearch. The default is the null, and authentication will only be performed
if both the username and password are non-null.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: batch.size
config_defs.documentation: The number of records to process as a batch when writing to Elasticsearch.Type: intDefault: 2000Valid Values: [1,â¦,1000000]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: bulk.size.bytes
config_defs.documentation:
The maximum size (in bytes) to be process as a batch when writing records to Elasticsearch.
Setting to â-1â will disable this configuration. If the condition set by âbatch.sizeâ is
met first, it will be used instead.Type: longDefault: 5242880 (5 megabytes)Valid Values: [-1,â¦,2147483647]Importance: low

config_defs.name: max.in.flight.requests
config_defs.documentation: The maximum number of indexing requests that can be in-flight to Elasticsearch before blocking further requests.Type: intDefault: 5Valid Values: [1,â¦,1000]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: max.buffered.records
config_defs.documentation:
The maximum number of records each task will buffer before blocking acceptance of more records. This config can be used
to limit the memory usage for each task.Type: intDefault: 20000Valid Values: [1,â¦,2147483647]Importance: low

config_defs.name: linger.ms
config_defs.documentation:
Linger time in milliseconds for batching. Records that arrive in between
request transmissions are batched into a single bulk indexing request, based
on thebatch.sizeconfiguration. Normally this only occurs under load when
records arrive faster than they can be sent out. However it may be desirable
to reduce the number of requests even under light load and benefit from bulk
indexing. This setting helps accomplish that - when a pending batch is not
full, rather than immediately sending it out the task will wait up to the
given delay to allow other records to be added so that they can be batched
into a single request.Type: longDefault: 1Valid Values: [0,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: flush.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The timeout in milliseconds to use for periodic flushing, and when waiting for
buffer space to be made available by completed requests as records are added.
If this timeout is exceeded the task will fail.Type: longDefault: 180000 (3 minutes)Valid Values: [1000,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: flush.synchronously
config_defs.documentation:
True if flushes should wait for background processing to finish. This has a
throughput penalty and makes the connector less responsive but allows for
topic-mutating SMTs (for example,RegexRouterorTimestampRouter).Type: BooleanDefault:falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: max.retries
config_defs.documentation:
The maximum number of retries that are allowed for failed indexing requests.
If the retry attempts are exhausted the task will fail.Type: intDefault: 5Valid Values: [0,â¦,2147483647]Importance: low

config_defs.name: retry.backoff.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait before attempting the first retry
of a failed indexing request. Upon a failure, this connector may wait up to
twice as long as the previous wait, up to the maximum number of retries. This
avoids retrying in a tight loop under failure scenarios.Type: longDefault: 100Valid Values: [0,â¦,86400000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.compression
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to use GZip compression on HTTP connection to ElasticSearch. To make
this setting to work thehttp.compressionsetting also needs to be enabled
at the Elasticsearch nodes before using it.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: max.connection.idle.time.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait before dropping an idle connection
to prevent a read timeout.Type: intDefault: 60000 (1 minute)Valid Values: [-1,â¦,86400000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait when establishing a connection to
the Elasticsearch server. The task fails if the client fails to connect to the
server in this interval, and will need to be restarted.Type: intDefault: 1000 (1 second)Valid Values: [0,â¦,43200000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: read.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the Elasticsearch server to send a
response. The task fails if any read operation times out, and will need to be
restarted to resume further operations.Type: intDefault: 3000 (3 seconds)Valid Values: [0,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: log.sensitive.data
config_defs.documentation:
If set totrue, the parameter logs sensitive data, such as exception
traces containing sensitive data. Note that this is parameter is optional.
Confluent recommends you configurelog.sensitive.dataif you experience
unusual logging behavior after upgrading to a later version of the connector.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: key.ignore
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to ignore the record key for the purpose of forming the Elasticsearch
document ID. When this is set totrue, document IDs will be generated as
the recordâstopic+partition+offset. Note that this is a global config
that applies to all topics, usetopic.key.ignoreto override astruefor specific topics.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: high

config_defs.name: schema.ignore
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to ignore schemas during indexing. When this is set totrue, the
record schema will be ignored for the purpose of registering an Elasticsearch
mapping. Elasticsearch will infer the mapping from the data (dynamic mapping
needs to be enabled by the user). Note that this is a global config that
applies to all topics, usetopic.schema.ignoreto override astruefor
specific topics.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: compact.map.entries
config_defs.documentation:
Defines how map entries with string keys within record values should be
written to JSON. When this is set totrue, these entries are written
compactly as"entryKey":"entryValue". Otherwise, map entries with string
keys are written as a nested document{"key":"entryKey","value":"entryValue"}. All map entries with non-string keys are always written as
nested documents. Prior to 3.3.0, this connector always wrote map entries as
nested documents, so set this tofalseto use that older behavior.Type: booleanDefault: trueImportance: low

config_defs.name: topic.key.ignore
config_defs.documentation: List of topics for whichkey.ignoreshould betrue.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: topic.schema.ignore
config_defs.documentation: List of topics for whichschema.ignoreshould betrue.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: drop.invalid.message
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to drop the Kafka message when it cannot be converted to an output
message.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: behavior.on.null.values
config_defs.documentation:
How to handle records with a non-null key and a null value (for example, Kafka
tombstone records). Valid options areIGNORE,DELETE, andFAIL.Type: stringDefault: FAILValid Values: [IGNORE, DELETE, FAIL]Importance: low

config_defs.name: behavior.on.malformed.documents
config_defs.documentation:
How to handle records that Elasticsearch rejects due to the following
malformed document exception errors:strict_dynamic_mapping_exceptionmapper_parsing_exceptionillegal_argument_exceptionaction_request_validation_exceptionignorewill skip records with these errors.failwill fail the
connector.NoteIn case of other malformed document errors, the connector sends
the records to the DLQ along with the exception and the connector fails,
even if this property is set toignore.Type: stringDefault: FAILValid Values: [ignore, warn, fail]Importance: low

config_defs.name: write.method
config_defs.documentation:
Method used for writing data to Elasticsearch, and one of INSERT or UPSERT.
The default method is INSERT in which the connector constructs a document from
the record value and inserts that document into Elasticsearch, completely
replacing any existing document with the same ID; this matches previous
behavior. The UPSERT method will create a new document if one with the
specified ID does not yet exist, or will update an existing document with the
same ID by adding or replacing only those fields present in the record value.
The UPSERT method may require additional time and resources of Elasticsearch,
so consider increasing theread.timeout.msand decreasing thebatch.sizeconfiguration properties.Type: stringDefault: INSERTValid Values: [INSERT, UPSERT]Importance: low

config_defs.name: use.autogenerated.ids
config_defs.documentation: Specifies whether to use auto-generated Elasticsearch document IDs for insertion requests. Note that this setting removes exactly once guarantees, and message delivery will be at least once. This only applies if the write method is set toINSERT. When set totrue, the Ignore Key mode option will also be ignored when sending data to Elasticsearch.Type: stringDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: proxy.host
config_defs.documentation:
The address of the proxy host to connect through. Supports the basic
authentication scheme only.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: proxy.port
config_defs.documentation: The port of the proxy host to connect through.Type: intDefault: 8080Valid Values: [1,â¦,65535]Importance: low

config_defs.name: proxy.username
config_defs.documentation: The username for the proxy host.Type: stringDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: proxy.password
config_defs.documentation: The password for the proxy host.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.security.protocol
config_defs.documentation: The security protocol to use when connecting to Elasticsearch. Values can bePLAINTEXTorSSL. IfPLAINTEXTis passed, all configs prefixed byelastic.https.will be ignored. This is optional for client.Type: stringDefault:PLAINTEXTValid Values: [PLAINTEXT, SSL]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for
client.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.location
config_defs.documentation:
The location of the key store file. This is optional for client and can be
used for two-way authentication for client.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation:
The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and
only needed ifssl.keystore.locationis configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.truststore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the trust store file.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password for the trust store file. If a password is not set, access to the
trust store is still available, but integrity checking is disabled.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.enabled.protocols
config_defs.documentation:
The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections. The default isTLSv1.2,TLSv1.3when running with Java 11 or later, andTLSv1.2otherwise. With the default value for Java 11, clients and servers will preferTLSv1.3if both support it and fallback toTLSv1.2otherwise (assuming
both support at leastTLSv1.2). This default should be fine for most cases.
Also see the configuration documentation forssl.protocol.Type: listDefault: TLSv1.2,TLSv1.3Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keystore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.protocol
config_defs.documentation:
The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext. The default isTLSv1.3when running with Java 11 or later,TLSv1.2otherwise. This value should
be fine for most use cases. Most recent JVMs allowTLSv1.2andTLSv1.3.TLS,TLSv1.1,SSL,SSLv2, andSSLv3may be
supported in older JVMs, but their usage is discouraged due to known security
vulnerabilities. With the default value for this config andssl.enabled.protocols, clients will downgrade toTLSv1.2if the server
does not supportTLSv1.3. If this config is set toTLSv1.2, clients
will not useTLSv1.3even if it is one of the values in
ssl.enabled.protocols and the server only supportsTLSv1.3.Type: stringDefault: TLSv1.2Importance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.provider
config_defs.documentation:
The name of the security provider used for SSL connections. Default value is
the default security provider of the JVM.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: medium

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.truststore.type
config_defs.documentation: The file format of the trust store file.Type: stringDefault: JKSImportance: medium

settings for a network connection using TLS or SSL network protocol. By

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithm
config_defs.documentation:
The endpoint identification algorithm to validate server hostname using server
certificate. Disable server host name verification by settingelastic.https.ssl.endpoint.identification.algorithmto an empty string.Type: stringDefault: httpsImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.engine.factory.class
config_defs.documentation: The class of typeorg.apache.kafka.common.security.auth.SslEngineFactoryto provide SSLEngine objects. Default value isorg.apache.kafka.common.security.ssl.DefaultSslEngineFactoryType: classDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.keymanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation:
The algorithm used by key manager factory for SSL connections. Default value

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.secure.random.implementation
config_defs.documentation: The SecureRandom PRNG implementation to use for SSL cryptography operations.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: elastic.https.ssl.trustmanager.algorithm
config_defs.documentation:
The algorithm used by the trust manager factory for SSL connections. Default
value is the trust manager factory algorithm configured for the JVM.Type: stringDefault: PKIXImportance: low

config_defs.name: kerberos.user.principal
config_defs.documentation: The Kerberos user principal the connector may use to authenticate with Kerberos.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: low

config_defs.name: kerberos.keytab.path
config_defs.documentation: The path to the keytab file to use for authentication with Kerberos.Type: stringDefault: nullValid Values: Existing file with keytab extension.Importance: low
config_defs.default: nullvalid values: existing file with keytab extension.importance: low

config_defs.name: max.retries
config_defs.documentation:
The maximum number of retries that are allowed for failed indexing requests.
If the retry attempts are exhausted the task will fail.Type: intDefault: 5Valid Values: [0,â¦,2147483647]Importance: low

config_defs.name: retry.backoff.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait before attempting the first retry
of a failed indexing request. Upon a failure, this connector may wait up to
twice as long as the previous wait, up to the maximum number of retries. This
avoids retrying in a tight loop under failure scenarios.Type: longDefault: 100Valid Values: [0,â¦,86400000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.compression
config_defs.documentation:

this setting to work thehttp.compressionsetting also needs to be enabled
at the Elasticsearch nodes before using it.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: max.connection.idle.time.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait before dropping an idle connection
to prevent a read timeout.Type: intDefault: 60000 (1 minute)Valid Values: [-1,â¦,86400000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: connection.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait when establishing a connection to
the Elasticsearch server. The task fails if the client fails to connect to the
server in this interval, and will need to be restarted.Type: intDefault: 1000 (1 second)Valid Values: [0,â¦,43200000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: read.timeout.ms
config_defs.documentation:
The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the Elasticsearch server to send a
response. The task fails if any read operation times out, and will need to be
restarted to resume further operations.Type: intDefault: 3000 (3 seconds)Valid Values: [0,â¦,604800000]Importance: low

config_defs.name: log.sensitive.data
config_defs.documentation:
If set totrue, the parameter logs sensitive data, such as exception
traces containing sensitive data. Note that this is parameter is optional.
Confluent recommends you configurelog.sensitive.dataif you experience
unusual logging behavior after upgrading to a later version of the connector.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: key.ignore
config_defs.documentation:
Whether to ignore the record key for the purpose of forming the Elasticsearch
document ID. When this is set totrue, document IDs will be generated as
the recordâstopic+partition+offset. Note that this is a global config
that applies to all topics, usetopic.key.ignoreto override astruefor specific topics.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: high

config_defs.name: schema.ignore
config_defs.documentation:

record schema will be ignored for the purpose of registering an Elasticsearch
mapping. Elasticsearch will infer the mapping from the data (dynamic mapping
needs to be enabled by the user). Note that this is a global config that
applies to all topics, usetopic.schema.ignoreto override astruefor
specific topics.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

config_defs.name: compact.map.entries
config_defs.documentation:
Defines how map entries with string keys within record values should be
written to JSON. When this is set totrue, these entries are written
compactly as"entryKey":"entryValue". Otherwise, map entries with string
keys are written as a nested document{"key":"entryKey","value":"entryValue"}. All map entries with non-string keys are always written as
nested documents. Prior to 3.3.0, this connector always wrote map entries as
nested documents, so set this tofalseto use that older behavior.Type: booleanDefault: trueImportance: low

config_defs.name: topic.key.ignore
config_defs.documentation: List of topics for whichkey.ignoreshould betrue.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

config_defs.name: topic.schema.ignore
config_defs.documentation: List of topics for whichschema.ignoreshould betrue.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: low

message.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: low

behavior. The UPSERT method will create a new document if one with the
specified ID does not yet exist, or will update an existing document with the
same ID by adding or replacing only those fields present in the record value.

so consider increasing theread.timeout.msand decreasing thebatch.sizeconfiguration properties.Type: stringDefault: INSERTValid Values: [INSERT, UPSERT]Importance: low
